solution_line_template: First find the total number of ducklings the first two ducks have: {ducks1} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck1} ducklings/duck = <<{ducks1}*{ducklings_per_duck1}={ducklings1}>>{ducklings1} ducklings
Then find the total number of ducklings the next six ducks have: {ducks2} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck2} ducklings/duck = <<{ducks2}*{ducklings_per_duck2}={ducklings2}>>{ducklings2} ducklings
Then find the total number of ducklings the last 9 ducks have: {ducks3} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck3} ducklings/duck = <<{ducks3}*{ducklings_per_duck3}={ducklings3}>>{ducklings3} ducklings

Then add up all the ducks and ducklings to find the total number: {ducklings1} ducklings + {ducklings2} ducklings + {ducklings3} ducklings + {ducks1} ducks + {ducks2} ducks + {ducks3} ducks = <<{ducklings1}+{ducklings2}+{ducklings3}+{ducks1}+{ducks2}+{ducks3}={total}>>{total} ducks
